Finesse Stance

Requirement: A weapon with the Finesse trait.

You place your feet at a near-right angle, distributing your weight evenly. You raise your weapon in your front arm and balance with your other, bending your knees slightly for more stability and to better jab, parry, and riposte your opponent.

Pros

Vital Strike

  • The natural roll required for a critical hit is reduced by 1. For example, if a Natural 20 is a critical hit, you can roll a critical hit with a Natural 19 as well.
  • Your weapon damage die is increased by one for critical hits.

Parry

  • As a minor action, you can cause a creature you can see to have disadvantage on attacks against you until the beginning of your next turn.

Riposte

  • As a reaction, you can make an opportunity attack against a creature you see when they miss you with an attack.
  • Once per round, if you are in Self-Defense or are Parrying the target, you can make that opportunity attack as a non-action.

Cons

En Garde

  • Attacks made during your turn have their damage die size reduced by one.
